revised_title: Electrometric Titration of Amino-Acids in Aqueous-Alcoholic Solutions
tldr: The authors investigate the titration of amino-acids in aqueous-alcoholic solutions and provide evidence in favor of the zwitterion theory. They discuss the acid-base behavior of amino-acids and the differences in their dissociation constants in various solvents, emphasizing the importance of the dielectric constant and solvation effects.
